intro: Clypeola jonthlaspi proles petraea, commonly known as the rock clypeola, is a rare and specialized plant adapted to grow in rocky and arid environments. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features a compact growth habit with small, ovate leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of hairs. Its flowers are typically small and white or pale yellow, arranged in umbels, a characteristic feature of the family. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a sensitive indicator species for ecological health.
